p: “It is also tempting to speculate that the 2015/2016 imbalance in reporting may have been a general phenomenon across Brazil. […] This, together with our conclusion that low MC risk with very high attack rates makes ZIKV a public health concern, could explain why most MC reports at the level of the country were in 2015 [de Oliveira et al., 2017], although for many regions the total reported number of ZIKV cases may have been surprisingly small that year.”
